p:
The main symptoms of COVID-19 are fever, dry cough, expectoration, and fatigue. Some of these patients present with anorexia, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
12, 13 Our previous study reported the symptoms of 91 patients with COVID-19 in whom 71.43% had fever, 60.44% reported a dry cough, 32.97% reported expectoration, and 23.08% had diarrhea. Asymptomatic infections were also reported.
14, 15 The current patient was a middle-aged woman with no epidemiological history of COVID-19. She did not have fever or dry cough, which are the two most common COVID-19 symptoms. Gastrointestinal symptoms were the first manifestations for COVID-19 in this case.
